activities: We use personal information received from employees in order to process their employment and benefits paperwork, including for payroll purposes. We use personal information received to process job applications. We use personal information received from individual customers  to respond to inquiries; fulfill requests; provide such customers with our products and services, including software updates; send administrative information, including announcements regarding our products or services, and changes to our terms, conditions, and policies; complete and fulfill customer purchases, and provide related customer service; and send marketing communications, including special offers and information regarding events. We also use such personal information for our business purposes, such as performing data analysis and audits, developing new products, improving our services, identifying usage trends, and determining the effectiveness of our promotional campaigns. In addition, we use such information as we believe to be necessary or appropriate under applicable laws; to comply with legal process; to respond to requests from public and government authorities; to enforce our terms and conditions; to protect our operations or those of any of our affiliates; to protect our rights, privacy, safety, or property and/or that of our affiliates, our customers, or others; and to allow us to pursue available remedies or limit the damages that we may sustain.
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
recoursemech: JAMS San Francisco for third party complaints, and European data protection authorities the Swiss Federal Data Protection and Information Commissioner with respect to employee complaints.
